capsules_submitted.utterance: Petunia's lineage is quite interesting. I've been studying its history and I can confirm that it has a complex relationship with its maculogy. It seems like the unique patterns on its petals are actually a result of this intricate connection.

You know, I was reading about petunias the other day and it's really interesting to learn about their lineage. Apparently, they have this complex history with different species and cultivars that have been crossed over time. And what's fascinating is how their maculogy - or the pattern of spots on their leaves - can vary so much depending on the specific variety. I mean, some petunias have these beautiful, delicate patterns, while others are more solid-colored. It's really amazing to think about how something as seemingly simple as a flower can have such a rich and complex history behind it.
